reviews.text: The rooms are standard size, and the bathroom is small, but the beds here are very comfortable and sleeping was a dream. The hotel restaurant was one of the best places in downtown Halifax to eat. There is a connected ped way that you can use to take you to the mall, casino, and other places downtown.
reviews.title: Such comfortable beds!

reviews.text: Hosted a meeting at the Delta Halifax on December 3rd and every detail was just as we had asked; booking the event was seamless and trouble-free. The catered food was quite good and the meeting room was bright and comfortable. All staff were a pleasure to deal with and the meeting package was an excellent value.
reviews.title: Great Meeting Services & Room Stay @ Delta Halifax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also stayed here overnight and this too was a great experience - room was clean and comfortable. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant, Harbour City Grill, and it was a great meal, our table especially enjoyed the steaks and the gorgeous desserts.
reviews.title: Great Exprience

reviews.text: I would not hesitate to stay here again, and I'd certainly host an event here again.
reviews.title: Great staff

reviews.text: We stayed at the Delta Halifax for the last leg of our honeymoon. They left a treat and thank you card for us in our room that was a nice, welcoming touch to our romantic stay. They made sure to book us a room with a view, and what a view it was! This location is fantastic, right downtown, and has a great restaurant. It's a little confusing to get to the underground corridors and mall, but once we figured it out, we had an easy time navigating. It is close by Citadel Hill, the arena, the maritime museum, and the waterfront. We walked to the farmers market on Saturday to get some treats, which took us about 20 minutes from our hotel.
reviews.title: Very comfortable corporate venue

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 night to run the Blue Nose half marathon. It was conveniently located right at the start line, which was linked so we didn't have to go outside. Considered it being a chilly and windy morning. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Restaurant food was great and resonably priced.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: Stayed for five nights to run the Bluenose Half Marathon. Great location, rooms decent--nothing spectacular--but the friendliness and service of the staff made up for it! Kjersti stood out as an exemplary staffperson/representative of the hotel--she seemed to be everywhere, and always friendly! The hotel's restaurant is very good, the location of the hotel two blocks from the water but also connected to the indoor pedestrian system with the mall and the convention center close by is outstanding. One hiccup was in the arrangements for our departure, when information did not get conveyed properly and we did not get the airport service we had negotiated the night prior. Otherwise, great stay!
reviews.title: Great place to stay for the Bluenose!

reviews.text: I genuinely want to Thank Emily & Kjersti from guest services for our warm welcome! They went out of their way to make sure our girl's weekend started out on the right foot! Very grateful for our surprise! We enjoyed our stay from check-in to check-out. The hotel has delicious food, I loved the lobster club! The bar staff were friendly too. Great weekend & thanks for the thoughtfulness!
reviews.title: Welcoming & Friendly

reviews.text: Not sure why this hotel has so many rave reviews, I didn't find anything special about my stay in the Delta.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: On check-in we were asked if we wanted to pay to upgrade to a harbor view room... we thought this sounded nice so we went for it. The room had virtually no view of the harbor and seemed small and old fashioned. We felt disappointed.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Delta Halifax for work. Rooms were clean and comfy. My old feedback of the not so good is the value you get for Breakfast. Its expensive and nothing great. Better off heading to Scotia Square Mama Gratti's.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Will stay at the Hotel again though.
reviews.title: Pretty average

reviews.text: I stayed at the Delta Halifax for one night while on a business trip. Before I arrived, I emailed their reservations department to ask for a "room with a view" as I was only there for one night and wanted to see as much of the city from the room as I could. I was upgraded to a junior suite which had a nice view of one of the two major bridges that cross the harbour.
reviews.title: This is my hotel, so to speak

reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The room was large, with a sofa, chair, coffee table and a desk, along with a king sized bed. The bed was set up in a weird location as it did not face the TV (but it did have an excellent view towards the window). They should install a swivle mount so the TV can be viewed from the bed and the lounging area. Also, the room was somewhat dated and the bed was not in the best condition.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located in downtown, attached to Scotia Square and walking distance to the waterfront. Check in was quick and our room was clean and comfortable. The indoor pool is very nice for a hotel pool and we used it several times. The only negatives are the parking. I had trouble twice with the parking pass at the gate and its expensive and adds up if you spend many nights. We ordered room service twice and one time I was told 20-30 minutes and it took just over 45 minutes and the food was cold, overcooked and a complete waste of my money.
reviews.title: Great Stay Overall
Great stay at Delta
reviews.text: We had three rooms for two nights. Location is great and there is a convenient walkway to shops, food casino and boardwalk. Check in was quick and pleasant. On our first night returning to our room after a busy day, we came in to find chocolate covered strawberries and blackberries and a couple glasses of wine waiting in our room with a nice card. Wishing us a happy anniversary, we thought what a nice thing to do. We only mentioned it at check in briefly and it really was a nice and caring gesture. The rooms were clean and the pool was great. We had a nice dinner in the restaurant by the lobby. Overall would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Halifax.
Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable!!
reviews.title: It was ok

reviews.text: The hotel has a great location if you want to be close to downtown. The pedway system is very convenient and the hotel is also connected to the Scotia Square mall. The front desk staff were very nice. The room was just ok, nothing spectacular. It seems like it may be in need of some updating and the carpets needed vacuuming. It was also very small. Our view was of apartment buildings across the street so that wasn't the best. We had to pay for parking at a parking garage next door. The pool area was very nice with the pool and a hot tub and plenty of room for seating. Overall, it was just ok, not sure if we would stay there again
reviews.title: Great staff and a comfortable stay
Very friendly staff and affordable hotel in downtown.
reviews.text: The staff at a hotel make all the difference in the world to me. This particular Delta hotel is great that way. The staff are always helpful and will do everything they can to make your stay enjoyable. They have renovated their lobby and restaurant/lounge. It's really comfortable. One downside for this Delta is that they don't have a Signature Club lounge. This one is a personal preference, but I like it when I can leave a fan on steady so as not to be woken through the night when the air conditioning or heat comes on. This one woke me up a few times.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great location, we usually shop the go to the hotel, we park and then check in. After we get our room we usually go for a swim and then head out for a walk and find somewhere to eat, there are lots of nice places nearby and we loved the food at the hotel as well:)
reviews.title: Love staying here

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night before returning home to England, we booked a double room with a fantastic view of the harbour. We had mentioned to the staff that whilst we were staying it was our wedding anniversary after having a wonderful meal in the restaurant we had a night out in the adjoining casino which can be reached by a glass bridge/walkway. We had a little win which made our night even more enjoyable. When we returned back to our room, the staff had turned down our room and left a personal message and handmade chocolates on our bed wishing us a happy anniversary, a lovely personal touch . The rooms were very modern, spacious and clean and the staff were fantastic, very friendly, helpful, welcoming and done everything to make our stay a great one, thank you delta hope to see you next year when we next visit Nova Scotia
reviews.title: Great stay, would definitely visit again

reviews.text: Spent three nights at the hotel. Really enjoyed the stay. Staff were helpful and the room was clean and confortable. It is connected to the ScotiaCentre with its many shops and food court.
reviews.title: Great Stay, Great Staff

reviews.text: Parking is availale for a charge and is easily accessed
reviews.title: Great family vacation

reviews.text: Wouldn't hesitate going back.
